title: 111_hr3923
content: The Act is titled the "Sugar Loaf Fire Protection District Land Exchange Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The Act, titled the "Sugar Loaf Fire Protection District Land Exchange Act," defines terms such as District, Federal land, National Forest, and Non-federal land in relation to specific parcels of land in Colorado. The Sugarloaf Fire Protection District Proposed Land Exchange in unincorporated Boulder County, Colorado, is depicted on map number 3 dated November 12, 2009. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Sugarloaf Fire Protection District Proposed Land Exchange in unincorporated Boulder County, Colorado is depicted on map number 3 dated November 12, 2009. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. SEC. 3. LAND EXCHANGE. The District can offer to convey non-Federal land to the Secretary, who will then convey Federal land to the District. The land exchange is subject to applicable laws, with the Secretary able to accept cash payments exceeding 25% of the Federal land value. The District must cover survey and appraisal costs and agree on administrative cost allocation with the Secretary. The land exchange under subsection (a) must be completed within 1 year of the enactment of the Act. If not completed, the Secretary may offer to sell the Federal land to the District at fair market value. Proceeds from the sale will be deposited into a designated fund. Under the Sisk Act, the Secretary can use proceeds from cash equalization payments and sales for acquiring land in the National Forest. Acquired non-Federal land is added to the National Forest and managed according to the Weeks Law and other applicable laws. Public orders withdrawing land can be revoked. Revocation of public orders allows for the conveyance of Federal land to the District, withdrawing it from entry and appropriation under public land laws until the transfer is complete. The House of Representatives passed the bill on July 13, 2010.
